instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3435: What is 820-3435? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SSD_PWR_EN: What is SSD_PWR_EN? SSD_PWR_EN is a signal that tells the chip making the power rail for the SSD to turn on when it is high. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .
definitions.SSD_RESET_CONN_L: What is SSD_RESET_CONN_L? SSD_RESET_CONN_L is a signal that goes to the SSD that will put it in RESET mode which will keep it from working, when SSD_RESET_L is present. _L means whatever before the _L in the signal name is asserted when it is low voltage, such as 0.0v to 0.5v. .
definitions.PP1V05_S0:
What is PP1V05_S0? The PP1V05_S0 power rail is for various components on the logic board that require a 1.05V supply voltage in the S0 (on) state. This voltage rail is likely to be used by the CPU (for VCCIO), PCH (Platform Controller Hub).

.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO SSD
threads.message:
THIS BOARD DOESNT SHOW THE SSD, SO FAR I HAVE:

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0SW_SSD_FLT</SIGNAL> = 3.3
<SIGNAL>SSD_RESET_CONN_L</SIGNAL> = 3.3
<SIGNAL>SSD_CLKREQ_CONN_L</SIGNAL> = 3.3
<SIGNAL>SSD_PCIE_SEL_L</SIGNAL> = 0V (WHEN SSD PRESENT) 3.3 WHEN SSD REMOVED
<SIGNAL>SSD_DEVSLP</SIGNAL> = 0V
<SIGNAL>SSD_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> = 3.3
<SIGNAL>PCIE_CLK100M_SSD_N</SIGNAL> = 0V
<SIGNAL>PCIE_CLK100M_SSD_P</SIGNAL> = 0V

TRIED A DIFFERENT SSD, SAME RESULT...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO SSD
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>SSD_CLKREQ_CONN_L</SIGNAL> = 3.3"
Not good.
SSD must pull down this line when inserted.
Check connector and trace.
Post <CHIP>U3740</CHIP> voltages.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO SSD
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SSD_CLKREQ_CONN_L</SIGNAL> is 0v, I was checking the value with the SSD unplugged....
<CHIP>U3740</CHIP>
1 = 3.4
2 = 1.2
3 = 3.4
4 = 3.4
5 = 0
6 = 3.2
7 = 0
8 = 0

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO SSD
threads.message:
Values look good.
Check <CAPACITOR>C3710</CAPACITOR>-17, <CHIP>U3710</CHIP>/11, solders, traces, SSD connector.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO SSD
threads.message:
<CAPACITOR>C3710</CAPACITOR>-17 are fine
desoldered <CHIP>U3710</CHIP>/11 to see underneath, they look fine and traces where ok. put them back... still nothing... by pressing ALT I get to the boot option, but get no SSD there... I can boot from external drive but can´t see any internal hard drive...

I am using 2 samsung SSD drives, with any of those, when the board turns on, the samsung chip on the SSD gets burning hot...
on PIN 38 of  J3700 I get a resistance to ground of 2.9 Ohms is that normal value?

found that L7630 diode mode value is ,026 checking that area... everything seems to be fine... I get <SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0</SIGNAL> with no problems, 
<SIGNAL>P1V05S0_PGOOD</SIGNAL> = 3.3v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO SSD
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO SSD
threads.message:
I´m sorry, removed L7630
diode mode on PIN 1 = ,153 PIN 2 = ,026

<SIGNAL>P3V3_S0SW_SSD</SIGNAL> = 3.351v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO SSD
threads.message:
0.026 looks to low for this model.
Compare with similar CPU...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO SSD
threads.message: Found another 3435 board and the value is ,124 on L7630

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO SSD
threads.message: Then you have a problem with PCH, which explains SSD issue too.
